definition: to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly

sentences.english: Among working dog people, you will hear a lot of talk about drives.
sentences.chinese: 在工作犬友中，你会听到很多“驱力”的谈论。

sentences.english: Interest, attention and drive are all expressions of libido.
sentences.chinese: 兴趣，注意力及欲望驱力，都是力比多的表达。

sentences.english: When a dog is in defense drive, he is displaying aggressive behaviors.
sentences.chinese: 处于防御驱力下的犬只，将表现出进攻性行为。

sentences.english: And yet, according to the MRI, my libido is surprisingly strong.
sentences.chinese: 然而，根据核磁共振成像，我的性驱力出人意料的强。

sentences.english: would be to teach ordinary Americans how to control their unconscious drives.
sentences.chinese: 将是去教授普通美国人，如何控制他们的无意识驱力。

sentences.english: The circuit of the drive is the only way for the subject to transgress the pleasure principle.
sentences.chinese: 驱力的回圈是最好的方法，让主体逾越快乐原则。

sentences.english: Callie and Thunder both have roughly the same degree of defense drive.
sentences.chinese: 佳丽和雷电大致拥有同样程度的防御性驱力。

sentences.english: Think of each drive being on a continuum.
sentences.chinese: 要把每种驱力视为一个连续统。

sentences.english: Lacan maintains Freud's distinction between drive (Trieb) and instinct (Instinkt).
sentences.chinese: 拉康主张，弗洛伊德区别驱力与本能的差异。

pinyin: E2 di3 pu3 si1 qing2 jie2

definition: Floyd (name)/Freud (name)/Dr Sigmund Freud (1856-1939), the founder of psychoanalysis
inner transcendence (perfection through one's own inner moral cultivation, as in Confucianism, for example)
